msItem.note: Blank endleaves, except for title information and a note of acquisition on .

msContents.summary: Catena to the New Testament (Acts, Epistles of Paul)

msItem.title: Catena in Acta Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: τοῦτο ἀληθὲς καὶ τὸ τῶν σημείων Πνεῦμα
msItem.finalRubric: τέλος τοῦ κειμένου καὶ τῆς ἑρμηνείας τῶν πράξεων

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam ad Romanos
msItem.note: A list of the Epistles of Paul and the Catholic Epistles follows upon the Argumentum.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam primam ad Corinthios
msItem.rubric: Ὑπόθεσις τῆς πρὸς Κορινθίους πρώτης ἐπιστολῆς
msItem.note: Note that this explicit is situated at the bottom of f. 83, not on f. 91 as one could have expected. Cf. PG 118, sp. 873A.

supportDesc.foliation: foliation in pencil by a modern hand in the lower right margin: i–ii, 1–91, i’.
pagination in ink in the upper right marginof recto pages: 1–181.
Traces of an older foliation in ink in the upper right margin: see e.g. f. 4r (Γʹ), f. 10r (θʹ). Most of these numbers are lost due to trimming.

list.item: Q1 I(f.2) + Q2 II(f.6) + Q3 V(f.16) + Q4 III(f.22) + Q5 3 f.(f.25): no thread visible, f. 24 and f. 25 are pasted together at the inner margin + Q6 II(f.29) + Q7 1/2(f.32) + Q8 II(f.36) + Q9 2/1(f.39) + Q10–Q14 5 IV(f.79) + Q15 II(f.83) + Q16 IV(f.91).

collation.note: By way of restoration and rebinding, the order of the leaves and quires have ended up in great disarray. Extensive repair with new guards has resulted in anomalous bifolia, which fail to mirror the original state of the manuscript. Thus, the collation formula above only indicates the present state of the positioning of the leaves and sewing threads. The original order, however, was based on quaternions, except for the last quire which was a binion. The original quaternions would have had the leaves in the following sequence: ff. 2–8 (first leaf of this quaternion is lost); 1, 9–15; 16–23; 24–29, 32, 31; 30, 37, 33, 35, 36, 34, 38, 39; 64–71; 40–47; 48–55; 56–63; 72–79; 84–91; 80–83 (binion). It is also probable that another three quires were lost at the beginning of the volume, if one is to assume that the text originally covered a complete Commentary to the Acts, i.e. also to Acts I–VIII, 8.

msContents.summary: Catena to the New Testament (Epistles of Paul, Catholic Epistles)

msItem.title: Commentarius in Pauli Epistolam primam ad Corinthios
msItem.note: Cf. PG 118, sp. 836A. More or less the same passage of the catena is covered in ff. 80–83 and in ff. 92–96r.

msItem.title: Commentarius in Epistolam Judae
msItem.explicit: οἱ ἀπὸ Σίμωνος καὶ τῶν ὁμοίων ἐπιτήδευον κατὰ τοὺς προειρημένους λόγους

supportDesc.foliation: foliation in pencil by a modern hand in the lower right margin: 92–220.
pagination in ink in the upper right marginof recto pages: 183–439.

list.item: Q17–Q29 13 IV(f.195) + Q30 (IV + 3(f.196–198))f.206: 3 single leaves pasted together and onto the following quaternion + Q31 IV(f.214) + Q32 III(f.220)

layout.note: On some pages the ruling pattern is closer to Sautel 20A1">, although this may be due to the scribe being less accurate in the execution.

bindingDesc.p: Lace-attached case binding sewn on three supports. Half covered with parchment and marbled paper over paper boards.
